name: Mountain
title: Mountain Pose
text:
• Stand tall with big toes touching and heels together.
Draw your abdominal in and up and relax your shoulders down and back.
Breathe five to eight breaths while actively engaging your leg muscles.
• Benefits:
Balance and grounding through the feet.

name: Tree
title: Tree Pose
text:
• Stand tall, and place one foot on the opposite inner thigh, either above or below the knee. (start with Baby Tree or use a chair for support)
Open the leg to the side, bring your hands to prayer, and stay for five to eight breaths.
• Benefits:
Balance, concentration, leg and abdominal strength.

name: Bird
title: Bird Pose
text:
• Start kneeling, and stretch one arm forward and the opposite leg back.
Imagine you have a tea cup on your back and draw your belly button towards your spine.
Stay for a breath, then switch sides. Repeat five times.
• Benefit:
Balance, concentration, abdominal and back support.

name: Dog
title: Downward Facing Dog
text:
• Start on hands and knees, tuck your toes under, and lift your hips up and back until your body forms a triangle.
Use your core strength and legs to bring the weight back as much as possible.
Stay for five to eight breaths, lower down, and repeat two more times.
For seniors with wrist issues, do Forearm Downward Dog instead.
• Benefits:
Joint health, flexibility, and all-over body strength.

name: Sphinx
title: Sphinx
text:
• Lie down on your stomach and place your forearms on the mat, elbows under your shoulders.
Press firmly into the arms and draw your shoulder blades together and down your back.
Lift your abdominals in and up and stay for five to eight breaths.
• Benefits:
Upper back strength and preventing forward head syndrome.

name: Cobbler
title: Cobbler's Pose
text:
• Sit tall and bring the soles of the feet together as you open your knees out to the sides.
Fold forward for a deeper stretch but try to prevent rounding too much in the lower back.
Hold for five to eight breaths.
• Benefits:
Open hips, feet massage.

name: Savasana
title: Savasana
text:
• Lie down and let the floor support you.
Completely relax the muscles and breathe as you lie there and take a deep, restorative break.
• Benefits:
Aids nervous system, mental and physical peace.
